channel.title: dotnet/winforms Issues
channel.description: Issues from https://github.com/dotnet/winforms, generated by https://github.com/meziantou/IssuesToRss/

item.title: Issue: [Accessibility] AutomationID property should not be empty for dropdown items under ImageAlign/TextAlign/CheckAlign/Dock in PropertyGrid - @Olina-Zhang
item.description:
.NET version

.Net 8.0 SDK: 8.0.100-alpha.1.22469.15

Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

In .Net 3.1, this issue cannot repro, and .Net 6.0 and 7.0 can repro

Issue description

AutomationID property should not be empty for dropdown items under ImageAlign/TextAlign/CheckAlign/Anchor/Dock property in PropertyGrid

Inspect:

Steps to reproduce

Minimal repro:

  1. Create a winforms core app with PropertyGrid and RadioButton control.
  2. Associate the Button with PropertyGrid as a selected object.
  3. Build and run the core project.
  4. Start Inspect tool.
  5. Open the drop down list next to ImageAlign.
  6. Focus on "Top Center" and observe AutomationID property in Inspect.

Tested app: WinFormsApp13.zip

item.title: Issue: Binding is not working properly when using custom delegate and Generic EventHandler for respective properties - @GokulThanu
item.description:
.NET version

Net 6.0

Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No response

Issue description

The Binding is not working properly when using events with Custom delegate and Generic EventHandler delegate for respective properties.

The Binding is working Properly when using EventHandler delegate

Steps to reproduce

sample: https://github.com/GokulThanu/testingsamples/tree/main/Binding%20Issue-detailed/Binding%20Issue

Steps to reproduce

Run the sample Enter any Number in Custom control Note that the last textbox is alone updated.

Observed The last TextBox is alone updated with the value entered in the CustomControl

Expected All TextBox is to be updated with the values entered in the CustomControl

item.title: Issue: MFT_MENUBREAK or MFT_MENUBARBREAK flags for ContextMenuStrip - @LaraSQP
item.description:
Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

Unlike ContextMenu, ContextMenuStrip seems to be missing the MFT_MENUBREAK or MFT_MENUBARBREAK flags.

Please implement these.

Perhaps via ToolStripProfessionalRenderer?

Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered

As shown above.

Will this feature affect UI controls?

ContextMenuStrip

item.title: Issue: TextBox should set IsPassword accessible property when it contains password - @dmitrii-drobotov
item.description:
.NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22423.9

Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Worked in .NET 6 but not in .NET 7, didn't check earlier versions

Issue description

From Edit docs on UIA_IsPasswordPropertyId property:

Must be set to TRUE on edit controls that contain passwords. If an edit control does contain Password contents then this property can be used by a screen reader to determine whether keystrokes should be read out as the user types them.

There are UseSystemPasswordChar and PasswordChar properties on TextBox that allow formatting content as password.

Current behavior:

When setting either UseSystemPasswordChar or PasswordChar properties on a TextBox, the IsPassword property stays False.

Narrator announces all symbols entered into such text boxes.

Expected behavior:

When setting either UseSystemPasswordChar or PasswordChar properties on a TextBox, the IsPassword property becomes True, and screen readers don't announce characters entered into it.

Steps to reproduce

Sample application: TextBoxPasswordSample.zip

item.title: Issue: TextBox should set HelpText accessible property when it contains placeholder text - @dmitrii-drobotov
item.description:
.NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22423.9

Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

Issue description

From Edit docs:

If an edit control contains placeholder text (for example, a cue banner), the text should be used as the HelpText property unless the text can be edited by the user and then reused as placeholder text. For example, the Windows Internet Explorer address bar contains the text "about:Tabs" when a new tab is opened. This is not HelpText because it is a programmatic address that can be used or edited by the user.

There is a PlaceholderText property on a TextBox which acts as a placeholder. It cannot be edited by the user and disappears when TextBox gets focus, thus needs to be exposed as a HelpText.

Current behavior:

When setting PlaceholderText property on a TextBox with empty text, the HelpText property stays empty, and placeholder isn't announced by screen readers.

Narrator Buddy output when switching between these TextBoxes:

edit, Text box 1, edit, edit, Text box 3,

Placeholder text is not announced.

Expected behavior:

When PlaceholderText is non-empty and Text is empty, HelpText accessible property should have value of PlaceholderText. As a result, it should also be announced by screen readers.

Steps to reproduce

Sample application: TextBoxPlaceholderSample.zip

item.title: Issue: Narrator announces buttons inside ContentAligmentEditor incorrectly. - @NikitaSemenovAkvelon
item.description:
• .NET Core Version: 8.0.0-alpha.1.22467.6

Probled description: Narrator announces all options as "selected".

Expected behavior: Only for selected option it should announce "selected".

Originally posted by @Tanya-Solyanik in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7737#pullrequestreview-1109826285

item.title: Issue: DataGridView Flaky tests due to invalidatedCallCount - @kirsan31
item.description:
Test

DataGridView_ColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode_SetNonResizeThenResize_RestoresOldValue DataGridView_ColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected DataGridView_ColumnHeadersHeight_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected DataGridView_ColumnHeadersHeight_SetWithParentWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected DataGridView_OnColumnHeadersHeightChanged_InvokeWithHandle_CallsColumnHeadersHeightChanged DataGridView_OnColumnHeadersHeightSizeModeChanged_InvokeWithHandle_CallsColumnHeadersHeightSizeModeChanged DataGridView_OnRowHeadersWidthChanged_InvokeWithHandle_CallsRowHeadersWidthChanged DataGridView_OnRowHeadersWidthSizeModeChanged_InvokeWithHandle_CallsRowHeadersWidthSizeModeChanged DataGridView_Parent_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected DataGridView_RowHeadersWidthSizeMode_SetNonResizeThenResize_RestoresOldValue DataGridView_RowHeadersWidthSizeMode_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected DataGridView_RowHeadersWidth_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected DataGridView_RowHeadersWidth_SetWithParentWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected DataGridView_TopLeftHeaderCell_GetWithHandle_ReturnsExpected DataGridView_TopLeftHeaderCell_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected

Issue description

All these tests may randomly fail due to extra invalidations. This happens when the mouse pointer is above any cell of DataGridView. We can't properly fix this now because of:

  • UTs are run in parallel therefore we can't set the mouse pointer and guarantee that it will not be moved until the test is done.
  • DataGridView without columns does not visually display the left top header, but still tries to invalidate it's area.

Affected issues: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6597 It's hard to say if they are all, but probably yes. https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6739 https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6926

Steps to reproduce

item.title: Issue: MenuStrip accessibility for screen readers - @Menelion
item.description:
.NET version

6.0

Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

N/A

Issue description

The Story

Before, in .Net Framework, there was a classic MainMenu control that provided a classic native menu bar. It was super accessible, all screen readers read it correctly, the Escape key was processed automatically, as was the Alt key (it toggled the focus between the menu bar and the main window). to put it short, it was analogous to a menu bar written in pure Windows API.

However now, in .Net 6, there is only this MenuStrip class which behaves differently:

  • JAWS for Windows reports each item of the horizontal menu bar as having a submenu. Each vertical dropdown menu, when entered, is reported as context menu which is wrong. NVDA reports those items as collapsed, which is also wrong, they are just menu bar items. Narrator is super verbose in any menu bar, so I would suggest to try the other two.
  • The Escape key seems to have effect but the screen readers do not report "leaving menus" and the menu status seem to persist. At least, JAWS reports "leaving menus" only when alt-tabbing out of the sample application. The Alt key seems to have no effect.
  • The checked status of a checkable menu item is reported only by Narrator. As it is reported correctly in native menu bars, the issue is in the custom control itself.
  • The menu bar implemented this way lacks the system menu with elements like Move, Size, Minimize, Maximize etc. Alt+Space also does not work. With the native menu bar this menu is given free of charge.

I sketched a basic sample to show what I mean.

Steps to reproduce

  1. Run the sample app.
  2. Launch a screen reader, for instance, JAWS for Windows.
  3. Press Alt to go to the menu bar and see the behavior outlined in the issue description.
  4. Run Visual Studio any version, 2022 Preview included.
  5. Press Alt to go to the menu bar and spot the differences.

item.title: Issue: ComboBox raises selection property change even though it does not support the selection provider. - @Tanya-Solyanik
item.description:
ComboBox AccessibleObject raises ElementSelected property change event, however this control does not support the SelectionProvider. Docs specify this event/provider combination as required.

Result: Accessibility clients don't listen to events associated with this provider. Specifically, NVDA does not listen to it, resulting in compliance issue in VS property pages.

We can't remove this event because other clients are likely to rely on it. However, we can implement the missing pattern.

The same issue is present on .NET Framework 481,

Note: This bug was discovered while testing VS property pages under NVDA. Because winforms ComboBox does not report Selection provider as supported, NVDA is not listening to selection change event. From @rperez030

I had a chat with an NVDA developer yesterday, and he pointed me to the place in the source code where they are registering the elementSelected event. He believes it may not require any work on NVDA's site for it to work once the control exposes the proper patterns.

item.title: Issue: ComboBox supports Value UIA pattern, however, does not raise the property change event for value property - @Tanya-Solyanik
item.description:
According to the required events section in docs.

UIA_ValueValuePropertyId property-changed event. | If the control supports the Value control pattern, it must support this event. -- | --

UIA_ValueValuePropertyId property-changed event(UIA_AutomationPropertyChangedEventId) should be raised for UIA_ValueValuePropertyId because ComboBox supports the Value control pattern.

The same issue exists in .NET Framework 481. However VS had implemented a workaround - https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/compare/main...adamint:project-system:dev/adamint/legacy-prop-page-accessibility-fixes-august

Customer impact:

VS is hitting this issue in NVDA in property pages on 481. Narrator is handling lack of this property changed event by listening to property changed event for UIA_SelectionItem_ElementSelectedEventId. NVDA does not listed to that event because ComboBox does not support the selection provider and thus NVDA is not updated properly per Roberto Perez investigation.

item.title: Issue: ComboBox control with DropDownList style should not support Value UIA pattern - @Tanya-Solyanik
item.description:
ComboBox controls are required to provide Value pattern (IValueProvider) only if the end user can add arbitrary values according to documentation.

IValueProvider | Depends | If the combo box can take arbitrary text values, the Value control pattern must be supported. This pattern enables the string contents of the combo box to be set programmatically. If the Value control pattern is not supported, the user must select from the list items within the subtree of the combo box. -- | -- | --

However we support this pattern unconditionally.

As a result, user will be tempted to enter an arbitrary value into the accessibility tools, will get a success result code but the desired value will not be assigned. The below screenshot reflects inspect experience with the WinformsControlsApp:

The text value entered(via Actions->Value.SetValue) is not available among the DropDownList values. and is not displayed in the combo's edit box, yet inspect reports success.

The same problem exists on .NET Framework 481

item.title: Issue: Faulting module name: coreclr.dll - @LukAss741
item.description:
.NET version

new6.0-windows

Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

6.0.422.16404 didn't work either.

Issue description

My application that is supposed to run 24/7 regularly crashes. This is what I see in event viewer:

Faulting application name: xx.exe, version: 1.0.0.0, time stamp: 0x62cf0990
Faulting module name: coreclr.dll, version: 6.0.822.36306, time stamp: 0x62cf0045
Exception code: 0xc0000005
Fault offset: 0x00000000001d1fdd
Faulting process id: 0x3ed8
Faulting application start time: 0x01d8c47bc2e2313a
Faulting application path: C:\Data\xx.exe
Faulting module path: C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App\6.0.8\coreclr.dll
Report Id: 525e6274-83f7-4540-8f3a-471a6655e70a
Faulting package full name: 
Faulting package-relative application ID:

Steps to reproduce

I have a large project. The program crashes very iregularly - sometimes every like 10 mintes other times it may run for a week without a single crash. Hence, I don't know what exactly causes the crash. Can you advise how to proceed?

item.title: Issue: Everytime I create a new project the designer breaks - @Chello1801
item.description:
Environment

Visual Studio 2022 17.3.3

I use NET 6.0, but it also affected 3.1 & 5.0.

Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

It did work in the past, but suddenly i just get this error that breaks the form designer.

Issue description

In every project I create, the form designer just doesnt work. This is the error it gives me:

at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Host.ProjectInfoProvider.NetCore.d__6.MoveNext()

Steps to reproduce

Create any WinForms project, doesnt matter if its NET 3.1, 5.0 or 6.0.

Diagnostics

No response

item.title: Issue: Got an exception when a TextBlock got focus: `System.Globalization.CultureNotFoundException:“Argument_CultureNotSupportedInInvariantMode Arg_ParamName_Name, culture Argument_CultureInvalidIdentifier, 2052 (0x0804)”` - @RightFS
item.description:
.NET version

Version: 6.0.303 Commit: 7494fee64a

Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

I don't know how to switch a wpf project target SDK.

Issue description

My code works well when I build it for debug, but not working in release mode.

There are two textblock in this window, and the exception will be throwed when I click any textblock. But the exception will NOT be throwed in debug build mode.

System.Globalization.CultureNotFoundException:“Argument_CultureNotSupportedInInvariantMode Arg_ParamName_Name, culture Argument_CultureInvalidIdentifier, 2052 (0x0804)”

<Window x:Class="Logistical.QueueManagementClient.Forms.LoginWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Logistical.QueueManagementClient"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        Closing="Window_Closing"
        Title="登录" Height="573" Width="978">
    <Window.Resources>
        <!--依赖属性 本页面用的样式-->
        <Style TargetType="Button">
            <Setter Property="Background" Value="Gold"></Setter>
            <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="Black"></Setter>
            <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="20"></Setter>
        </Style>
    </Window.Resources>
    <Grid >
        <!--定义行 2行 比例59:361-->
        <Grid.RowDefinitions>
            <RowDefinition Height="2*"/>
            <RowDefinition Height="3*"/>
            <RowDefinition Height="1*"/>
        </Grid.RowDefinitions>
        <!--定义列 2列 比例51:208-->
        <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="20*"/>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="55*"/>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="20*"/>
        </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
        <!--在第一行，第二列写入一个按钮 
        Grid.Row="0" Grid.Column="1" 是索引 
        Grid.Row="0"表示第一行
        Grid.Column="1"  表示第二列-->
        <StackPanel  Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="1" HorizontalAlignment="Center">
            <StackPanel Orientation="Horizontal" Height="30">
                <Label  Content="用户名" Width="60"/>
                <TextBox x:Name="user"  Text="admin" Width="200"/>
            </StackPanel>
            <StackPanel  Orientation="Horizontal" Height="30">
                <Label  Content="密    码" Width="60"/>
                <PasswordBox  x:Name="password" Width="200" />
            </StackPanel>
            <Button x:Name="loginBtn" Margin="22" Height="30" Background="{x:Null}" Content="登录" Click="LoginBtn_ClickAsync"/>
        </StackPanel>
    </Grid>
</Window>

Steps to reproduce

<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

	<PropertyGroup>
		<RuntimeIdentifier>win-x64</RuntimeIdentifier>
		<OutputType>WinExe</OutputType>
		<TargetFramework>net6.0-windows</TargetFramework>
		<Nullable>enable</Nullable>
		<UseWPF>true</UseWPF>
		<SelfContained>true</SelfContained>
		<PublishSingleFile>false</PublishSingleFile>
	</PropertyGroup>

	<ItemGroup>
		<PackageReference Include="System.Text.Json" Version="6.0.2" />
		<PackageReference Include="System.Text.Encoding.CodePages" Version="6.0.0" />
	</ItemGroup>
	
</Project>

<Window x:Class="Logistical.QueueManagementClient.Forms.LoginWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Logistical.QueueManagementClient"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        Closing="Window_Closing"
        Title="登录" Height="573" Width="978">
    <Window.Resources>
        <!--依赖属性 本页面用的样式-->
        <Style TargetType="Button">
            <Setter Property="Background" Value="Gold"></Setter>
            <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="Black"></Setter>
            <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="20"></Setter>
        </Style>
    </Window.Resources>
    <Grid >
        <!--定义行 2行 比例59:361-->
        <Grid.RowDefinitions>
            <RowDefinition Height="2*"/>
            <RowDefinition Height="3*"/>
            <RowDefinition Height="1*"/>
        </Grid.RowDefinitions>
        <!--定义列 2列 比例51:208-->
        <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="20*"/>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="55*"/>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="20*"/>
        </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
        <!--在第一行，第二列写入一个按钮 
        Grid.Row="0" Grid.Column="1" 是索引 
        Grid.Row="0"表示第一行
        Grid.Column="1"  表示第二列-->
        <StackPanel  Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="1" HorizontalAlignment="Center">
            <StackPanel Orientation="Horizontal" Height="30">
                <Label  Content="用户名" Width="60"/>
                <TextBox x:Name="user"  Text="admin" Width="200"/>
            </StackPanel>
            <StackPanel  Orientation="Horizontal" Height="30">
                <Label  Content="密    码" Width="60"/>
                <PasswordBox  x:Name="password" Width="200" />
            </StackPanel>
            <Button x:Name="loginBtn" Margin="22" Height="30" Background="{x:Null}" Content="登录" Click="LoginBtn_ClickAsync"/>
        </StackPanel>
    </Grid>
</Window>

build it in release mode and click a textInput area, and it will crash.

item.title: Issue: [HC] Menustrips' child control textbox borders are not visible - @Nora-Zhou01
item.description:
.NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22451.15

Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, it is not a regression issue

Issue description

Current Behavior: Menustrips' child control textbox borders are not visible HC Aquatic theme:

HC Desert theme:

HC Dusk theme:

HC Night Sky theme:

Expected Behavior: Menustrips' child control textbox borders can be seen

Steps to reproduce

  1. Turn on High Contrast theme in Windows settings
  2. Create a WinForms .NET core project
  3. Add MenuStrip control
  4. Add child controls MenuItem, TextBox, ComboBox respectively
  5. Ctrl+Shift+A add a Application Manifest File and uncomment windows 10
  6. Build and run

More Info:

  1. This issue is repro on all HC themes.
  2. This issue is repro on framework project.
